result.execSummary:
The defendant Lemetrius Quondale Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, coss and disbursements.  Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  If not paid, will convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with victims and the location of Jynx Nightclub.
Any counseling deemed appropriate by the department.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gu nor other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
--from KaRon Stewart dated 9/13/15, received and filed;
--(2) from Rev. Mark J Wenzel dated 5/13/15 and 5/15/15, received and filed;

Defendant Lemetrius Quondale Smith in court with Attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Lemetrius Quondale Smith in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Matter is set for sentencing on November 30, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant Lemetrius Quondale Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lemetrius Quondale Smith in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Stipulation to the defendant's previous adjudication in case #05JV501A is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Sworn for the state:Guadalupe Ramirez-Cervantes/MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rodolfo C.; Robert C.; Brian D.; Markus A. or Jynx Nightclub at 715 S 5th Street
